Sentencas: Sulfur compounds in fuels deactivate the surface of anode materials in solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs), which adversely affect the long-term durability.
Titulo: Density functional theory study for the enhanced sulfur tolerance of Ni catalysts by surface alloying

Sentencas: To solve this issue, it is important to design new SOFC anode materials with high sulfur tolerance.
Titulo: Density functional theory study for the enhanced sulfur tolerance of Ni catalysts by surface alloying

Sentencas: Unfortunately, it is difficult to completely replace the traditional Ni anode owing to its outstanding reactivity with low cost.
Titulo: Density functional theory study for the enhanced sulfur tolerance of Ni catalysts by surface alloying

Sentencas: As an alternative, alloying Ni with transition metals is a practical strategy to enhance the sulfur resistance while taking advantage of Ni metal.
Titulo: Density functional theory study for the enhanced sulfur tolerance of Ni catalysts by surface alloying

Sentencas: Therefore, in this study, we examined the effects of transition metal (Cu, Rh, Pd, Ag, Pt, and Au) doping into a Ni catalyst on not only the adsorption of H2S, HS, S, and H but also H2S decomposition using density functional theory (DFT) calculations.
Titulo: Density functional theory study for the enhanced sulfur tolerance of Ni catalysts by surface alloying

Sentencas: The dopant metals were selected rationally by considering the stability of the Ni-based binary alloys.
Titulo: Density functional theory study for the enhanced sulfur tolerance of Ni catalysts by surface alloying

Sentencas: The interactions between sulfur atoms produced by H2S dissociation and the surface are weakened by the dopant metals at the topmost layer.
Titulo: Density functional theory study for the enhanced sulfur tolerance of Ni catalysts by surface alloying

Sentencas: In addition, the findings show that H2S dissociation can be suppressed by doping transition metals.
Titulo: Density functional theory study for the enhanced sulfur tolerance of Ni catalysts by surface alloying

Sentencas: It turns out that these effects are maximized in the Au-doped Ni catalyst.
Titulo: Density functional theory study for the enhanced sulfur tolerance of Ni catalysts by surface alloying

Sentencas: Our DFT results will provide useful insights into the design of sulfur-tolerant SOFC anode materials.
Titulo: Density functional theory study for the enhanced sulfur tolerance of Ni catalysts by surface alloying
